prompt.content:
Imagine you are playing the game as Shirley.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Anna, Shirley, Betty, Thomas, Joshua, Richard, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Shirley's) goal: Deceive others, avoid detection, and eliminate villagers.

{secret}

prompt.content:
Imagine you are playing the game as Shirley.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Anna, Shirley, Betty, Thomas, Joshua, Richard, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Shirley's) goal: Deceive others, avoid detection, and eliminate villagers.

{secret}

Here is the context of the interaction:


Conversation Starts:

Turn #0: [Game] State: Night_werewolf. The game begins!
Shirley: [action] kill Thomas

Turn #1: Thomas: [action] kill Anna
[Game] Entering state: Night_seer

Turn #2: [Game] Entering state: Night_witch

Turn #3: [Game] Anna was killed by werewolves!
[Game] Entering state: Day_discussion

Turn #4: Shirley: said: "RIP Anna. N1 kill doesn’t give us much. Seer, please don’t out unless you actually hit a wolf; Witch, don’t random poison. We need pressure and commitments today. Everyone: give a top suspect and who you’d vote right now, with a reason. For me, early pressure on Joshua—if you hedge or avoid a stance, that pings me. Richard is my second look. Thomas and Betty, where are you at?"

Turn #5: Betty: said: "I'm looking for a pattern.  Charlie, you’re looking at someone.  What are you seeing?"

Turn #6: Thomas: said: "RIP Anna. Early takes:
- Joshua: Need a concrete stance from you. Who are your top two and why? If you hedge or sit back, I’m voting you today.
- Betty: The “Charlie” mention is odd—there is no Charlie. Also you asked a question instead of giving a read. Who would you vote right now, and why?
- Richard: Where are you at on Betty’s slip and on Shirley’s push on Joshua?
Right now I’d vote Joshua; if he comes in with real, committed reads, I’d pivot to Betty unless she convincingly clarifies the “Charlie” thing."

Turn #7: Joshua: said: "I'm looking for a pattern.  Charlie, you’re looking at someone. What are you seeing?"

Turn #8: Richard: said: "I've been listening and analyzing the conversation. I’m observing the dynamics between the villagers and the Werewolves, focusing on subtle shifts in suspicion and strategic discussions. I'm currently evaluating the information provided – particularly the recent 'action' choices, and the dialogue's implication of potential threats. I’m noting that Shirley is increasingly focused on a 'pattern' and identifying Joshua as a potential focal point. I’m preparing to engage in a deliberate, cautious discussion about the situation while subtly probing for inconsistencies.  I'll be using 'speak' to formulate my observations and responses, prioritizing clarity and strategic engagement.  I will avoid directly stating 'yes' or 'no' to avoid tipping off the other players."
[Game] Entering state: Day_vote

It is voting time. You MUST use the command 'vote NAME' to vote for a player to eliminate. e.g. 'vote Alice'
